Articles.Content: I would be amazing if in KSP2  there was a way to customize flags in game and not in the files. It would be even better if it was easy to make your own flag.
Something like a Paint to create your flags?
its really simple thoe
And opacity.

I'd love some sort of simple in-game editor, but it's not really that hard to make them and insert them externally. What I find hardest is scaling them properly, so what I vote for is some way to have flag resolutions universally supported instead of using the incredibly obscure and low resolution they require internally in KSP1.

10 hours ago, Lo.M said:

Something like a Paint to create your flags?

I think, something a lot simpler, where you can just add some color patterns and decals and adjust colors/scale/position is more than enough. And I don't think it should replace the current system, but rather add to it. Just have the editor write an image to the flags directory. It's really easy to set up and would make it a lot easier to bash together a quick mission flag, while still leaving option for people to make highly artistic custom versions in external editors.

5 hours ago, kerbiloid said:

And opacity.

Nepal wants to into space.

4 hours ago, starcaptain said:

Nepal wants to into space. 

Idk about Nepal, just on my previous job I made a transparent flag out of the plastic package and the flyer holder.

But after your words the idea looks even more viable.

Also, if print some emblem on a transparent flag, you can see it projected on the landscape.

5 hours ago, starcaptain said:

Nepal wants to into space. 

Yeah, full opacity might be a bit complicated, depending on how they set up the shaders for decals, but alpha-cutout is always an option. And with some temporal AA, the edges should look smooth regardless.
I think KSP2 should have a flag maker.

On 1/24/2021 at 5:42 AM, Caleb Kerman said:

I would be amazing if in KSP2  there was a way to customize flags in game and not in the files. It would be even better if it was easy to make your own flag.

I find it not too hard to make flags. Just know where to drop them in. If you need a place where to make flags in an easy way I recommend Google Drawings

Yes, a flag maker 'app' would be a nice feature, and presumably a fairly simple thing to incude.  It wouldn't 'need' to be accessible during play, but a link to it from the mission flag selector would make sense.

Maybe an extension to this idea is 'vessel nameplates'.  A craft, or part, specific 'nameplate' that can accept text input, working the in same way as ordinary mission flags do, but a bit longer and thinner proportions.

I think a simple import function built in with an open browser popping up to select jpgs would be fine or maybe something like an insiginia maker similar to something like halo could fit in, but no need to reinvent paint when we already have it.

Just now, Bej Kerman said:

It doesn't even have to be a built in paint program, just give me something so I don't have to faff around in the files like a moron.

I mean... once you know where to go you will always remember and it's super easy.

Just remember:

Program files(x86) -> Steam -> Steamapps -> Common -> Kerbal Space Program -> Gamedata -> Flags

Once you do it a couple of times it will be locked into your head

I find it to be a good thing too. Because you will learn how the game works and be able to install mods someday, it helps a lot to enhance your ksp experience.

Why not just an option in the menu to upload your own flags? It opens your file explorer, you select the .png of your flag, and boom, it's in the game and you can select it any time you want. Simple and easy to use without restricting people to in in-game flag editor that absolutely wouldn't stack up to GIMP or Photoshop or MSPaint. This'll make it a ton easier for more tech illiterate people to upload their own pictures into the game, and I doubt it would take very long to implement. I sometimes still have trouble installing mods and I've been playing the game for nearly 5 years now. being able to skip all of the unnecessary file navigation would be a blessing.
